item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban capture city of Kunduz
item.description: The group makes its biggest gain yet, the city of Kunduz, after heavy fighting with government forces.

item.title: Greece wildfires: PM describes 'nightmarish summer'
item.description: Thousands have been evacuated as wildfires continue to ravage parts of the country.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Capturing the perfect moment
item.description: Three sports photographers explain what goes into getting the best shots of the day at the Games.

item.title: Capitol riot: Off-duty Seattle police officers fired over assault
item.description: The officers stood by as Donald Trump's supporters stormed the government building, an inquiry says.

item.title: Cuba allows small and medium-sized private businesses
item.description: Up to 100 employees will now be allowed in private companies, in a major shift after mass protests.

item.title: Larry Page: Google co-founder granted New Zealand residency
item.description: The country's immigration services say he applied under a category for wealthy investors.

item.title: Bat killed by cat after record 1,200-mile journey
item.description: A record-breaking bat - the size of a human thumb - is discovered in Russia after flying from London.

item.title: Famous Central Park owl killed in crash with truck
item.description: Barry the beloved owl was hit by a maintenance vehicle in the park while searching for food.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: German pentathlon coach thrown out for punching horse
item.description: A German coach who appeared to strike a horse with her fist during the modern pentathlon is thrown out of the Olympics.

item.title: Mercer Street: Tanker blast evidence points to Iran, says US
item.description: The attack on the Israeli-operated merchant tanker last week killed two people.

item.title: Tokyo attack: Knife-wielding man injures 10 on train
item.description: The suspect allegedly told police he was angry when he saw women who "looked happy".

item.title: Dennis Thomas: Kool & The Gang founding member dies aged 70
item.description: He was one of the members who started the soul band that had massive hits like Celebration.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: Communities feel under siege as troops deployed
item.description: Residents say they're being treated like second-class citizens to stem a Covid outbreak.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Olympic athletes targeted by false and misleading claims
item.description: There's been a spate of content with incorrect claims around some of the competitors in Tokyo.

item.title: Climate change: Low-income countries 'can't keep up' with impacts
item.description: Officials warn that the severity of natural disasters is outpacing efforts to prevent their damage.

item.title: Abba Kyari: The Nigerian super sleuth wanted in the US
item.description: Highly decorated policeman Abba Kyari's reputation is under scrutiny over alleged fraud.

item.title: India teachersâ€™ fight for period leave gathers steam
item.description: Indian teachers' demand for period leave reignites debate over whether it's a positive step for women.

item.title: Week in pictures: 31 July - 6 August 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Tokyo attack: Women targeted 'for looking happy'
item.description: A female student is said to be seriously injured, while the others suffered less severe injuries.

item.title: Afghan interpreter: 'A better life for my wife and children in the UK'
item.description: Afghan interpreters who worked with British forces are being relocated to the UK, as the Taliban advance.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Olympic athletes struggle with heat at Games
item.description: This games are one of the warmest on record, with many athletes complaining about the high temperatures.

item.title: ICYMI: Surfing, an Olympic maze and a sheep stampede
item.description: Some of the stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: US tops final medal table at Tokyo Olympics
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jason Kenny wins seventh gold but Laura Kenny reign as omnium champion over
item.description: Jason Kenny becomes the first Briton to win seven Olympic golds by defending his keirin title - but wife Laura's reign as women's omnium champion has ended.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: US women win a record seventh basketball gold medal
item.description: A blistering United States outplayed hosts Japan to win a seventh successive women's basketball gold on Tokyo 2020's final day of action.

item.title: Boxer Harrington wins gold for Ireland
item.description: Irish boxer Kellie Harrington wins an Olympic gold medal after defeating Brazil's Beatriz Ferreira in the women's lightweight final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sifan Hassan wins 10,000m gold for third medal of Games
item.description: Dutchwoman Sifan Hassan wins the 10,000m to seal her second gold and third medal of the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: India wins first athletics gold in men's javelin
item.description: India has now won seven medals at Tokyo - one gold, two silver and four bronze, its biggest Olympic haul ever.
